review: Bactrim DS (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I was prescribed a 10 day supply of Bactrim DS for finger lesions infected with staph. Within 2 days I noticed that the infection started to heal. I also immediately experienced side effects of nausea, diarrhea, and heart palpitations. My doctor ordered me to have an echocardiogram/heart monitor as a result of irregularities she saw on my EKG while taking Bactrim. At the end of the 10 day supply, the infection had not cleared completely and I was given a second round. After starting the second round, I broke out into a rash that covered my entire body. I had to have a shot of Prednisone and take an additional 6 days. It has been more than a month since I took the last dose of Bactrim and I still am dealing with the original infection as well as being treated for chronic hives. I have not had heart palpitations since stopping the medication.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I had cellulitis on my face, which swelled up significantly. Having worked in healthcare as a nursing aid for several years, I knew it the diagnosis before the physician confirmed it and realized antibiotics would be necessary. What I didn’t expect was a horrendous neuropsychiatric reaction to the medication. I was extremely nervous and could not sleep on day 3 and ended up having a severe anxiety attack. The episodic depression and odd behaviour such as standing in one place without moving for hours was frightening. Thankfully, after 2 MORE hospital visits, I was put on a Cephalosporin which eliminated the anxiety. My family physician has put this medication on my chart with beside the penicillin allergy (anaphylaxis) and wrote neuropsychiatric reaction. Bactrim is BY FAR the WORST medication I’ve ever be on.

This antibiotic may work very well for most, however I had severe nausea and nonstop, uncontrollable vomiting on the 2nd day of taking this. I literally just had to sit next to the toilet for hours because I couldn't stop vomiting bile. I finally called my doctor and was told to stop taking bactrim.  I have now been switched to cephalexin to see how that goes. My sister had taken bactrim as well and also had severe and uncontrollable vomiting, so I'm wondering if intolerances to sulfa just runs in my family. I was taking bactrim for a suspected trauma-caused cellulitis infection, and it did seem to help with that. The side effects were just way too severe for me.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I've taken Bactrim in the past,  usually just have gastrointestinal issues.  This time,  beginning day 3 of 7 I felt like I was hypoglycemic, nervous, jittery, anxious, and like my heart was racing.  Day 6 of 7 my resting heart rate was 142, anxiety so bad I was crying. I called the hospital that prescribed it and the nurses spoke to "talked to TWO doctors and NEVER heard of ANYTHING like that" I said "never mind that it's listed under severe side effects right?" I stopped taking it then (Dr said I could keep taking it or stop, it doesn't matter) 24 hours later,  I'm back to normal.  Resting heart rate is 83. I'll never take Bactrim again.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):After I got what I thought was just a minor infection from a wound caused by an ill-fitting pair of Vans, things progressed to the point where I had a festering boil on my right foot. The doctor had prescribed bactrim for the infection, specifcally 800/160mg of Sulfamethoxazole and Trimethoprim. I learned that this was a staph infection 3 days later when the wound culture results came back. The bactrim worked perfectly, with my staph infection clearing up in about a week, although it had made my acne slightly worse due to "purging." Apart from worsening acne, there were no other side effects. The pills were large but easy to swallow.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):Bactrim is extremely effective - where other antibiotics might fail - but many doctors seem to underestimate the severity of side-effects (including uncommon ones). It is always difficult for me to be consistent with Bactrim dosage because I experience severe nausea and bouts of dizziness. It may be easy to complain, but I also recognise that an alternative might not be appropriate. Instead, I asked to also be prescribed anti-nausea medication. It's not fun, but it can be tolerable.

I am SO happy I came across this website because I thought I was losing my mind today ! I immediately stopped and am waiting on my doctor to prescribe an alternative antibiotic.

Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim):I am sharing my experience because I want others to know there is hope from recovering from the extremely rare and life changing side effects that happened to me on Bactrim. I got worse as the months progressed and finally 6 months later I began to feel better. Had to quit my amazing job and was in the most depressed state  I'm healthy and 31 female.
